channel.title: Deploying Your App on GA JavaScript
channel.description: Recent content in Deploying Your App on GA JavaScript

item.title: Objectives
item.description: Deploy a JavaScript-based application using Github Pages, Surge or Heroku Learn how to secure sensitive credentials in a “non node-based” front-end application Deploy your final projects the approach that best fits your application’s needs

item.title: Github Pages
item.description: What is Github Pages? GitHub Pages is a static site hosting service designed to host your personal, organization, or project pages directly from a GitHub repository GitHub Pages is a static site hosting service and doesn’t support server-side code such as, Express (via Node JS), Ruby, Python or PHP

item.title: Code Along: Host App using Github Pages
item.description: Code Along: Host App using Github Pages Together we’ll walk through the process of hosting a static application, an application that does not have a server (i.e. Express), on Github Pages Instructions 1. Find Traffic Light project Using your operating system’s finder / explorer application, copy your Traffic Light application (project name: traffic-light) application from a lesson earlier in the course folder to your lesson_17 folder If you do not have a working version of traffic-light you can clone down a working version here

item.title: Surge
item.description: What is Surge? An alternative to Github pages Best used for Static websites Simple to deploy

item.title: Code Along: Host App using Surge
item.description: Code Along: Host App using Surge Together we’ll walk through the process of hosting a static website / application (that does not have a backend server like Express) using Surge Instructions 1. Install the surge package on your computer Run the following from your command line (from any folder location) to install surge globally on your computer $ npm install --global surge 2. Run surge from the Traffic Light project folder Navigate to the project folder of the Traffic Light application from the Github Pages Code Along
